topic.title: How to Generate Google Structured Data

body.p: It is possible to generate Google Structured Data (<script> elements that contain a JSON-LD object) in the DITA WebHelp Responsive output. Google uses this JSON-LD object to better understand the contents of the page and display special search results in a Google Search.For more details, see Google Search Central: Understand how structured data works.

To generate Google Structured Data in WebHelp output, use the following transformation parameter:
google.structured.data Specifies whether or not Google Structured Data will be generated in the output. If set to yes, the transformation automatically generates Google Structured Data for FAQ topics, DITA Task topics, and from <data> elements found inside a topic that has the @name="oxy:question" construct. If set to no (default value), the transformation will not generate Google Structured Data.

section.title: Generating Google Structured Data for DITA Tasks Topics
section.p: When Google Structured Data is enabled, the DITA Task <title>, <shordesc>, and <step> elements are mapped to the HowTo JSON-LD object. For example, the following DITA Task topic:<task id="task_id"> <title>My task</title> <shortdesc>Task description</shortdesc> <steps> <step> <cmd>Step 1 content.</cmd> </step> <step> <cmd>Step 2 content.</cmd> </step> </steps> </task>

section.title: Generating for QA Topics
section.p: When Google Structured Data is enabled, the QA topic <qagroup> elements are mapped to the FAQPage JSON-LD object. For example, the following QA topic:<qatopic id="qa_id"> <title>Faq Page 1</title> <qabody> <qagroup> <question>What is a car engine?</question> <answer>The car engine is a device that uses fuel to create mechanical power that can turn the car's wheels.</answer> </qagroup> </qabody> </qatopic>

section.title: Generating from data elements found inside a topic
section.p:
When Google Structured Data is enabled, the WebHelp Responsive transformation will map the elements found inside a topic to a FAQPage JSON-LD object. There are 2 different use cases depending on where the element is found in the document: In the element. For example, this content: Lawnmower The lawnmower is a machine used to cut grass in the yard. What tools are necessary to cut the grass?

Lawnmowers can be electric, gas-powered, or manual.

 will generate the following structure in the output: The answer represents the HTML result of the entire content inside the topic. Inside the topic body elements. For example, content: Morning In the morning we have breakfast.
    What do people drink in the morning?
  • Tea
  • Milk
 will generate the following structure in the output: The answer represents the HTML result of the entire block where the element is located inside.
